{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the most common fungal infection in neonates that is transmitted by a caregiver's hand. Looking at the documents, Document [23] mentions that Candida parapsilosis was the most frequently isolated species from the hands of healthcare workers. Document [30] also suggests that Candida albicans can be transmitted by the hands of healthcare workers. However, Document [24] emphasizes that Candida parapsilosis is the most common species found on the skin and is frequently implicated in nosocomial transmission. Therefore, Candida parapsilosis seems to be the most common fungal infection in neonates transmitted by caregiver's hand.", "answer_choice": "D. Candida parapsilosis"}
